value: Ved at give dit IBAN og bekræfte denne betaling godkender du %{merchant_name}, kreditor og Stripe, vores betalingstjenesteudbyder, til at sende instruktioner til din bank til at debitere din konto og din bank til at debitere din konto i overensstemmelse med disse instruktioner. Du har ret til en refusion fra din bank i henhold til vilkårene og betingelserne i din aftale med din bank. Der skal kræves refusion inden for 8 uger fra den dato, hvor din konto blev debiteret.

You are entitled to a refund from your bank under the terms and conditions of your agreement with your bank. A refund must be claimed within 8 weeks starting from the date on which your account was debited.

value:
Mandatets gyldighedsperiode, tilbagekaldelse
Mandatet er gyldigt indtil yderligere varsel. Betaleren har ret til når som helst at tilbagekalde mandatet ved at kontakte betalingsmodtager eller hans eller hendes betalingstjenesteudbyder. For at stoppe betalinger, der endnu ikke er gennemført, skal meddelelsen om tilbagekaldelse af mandatet være modtaget af betalingsmodtageren senest fem bankdage før forfaldsdatoen eller være modtaget af betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyder senest inden bankvirksomheden dag før forfaldsdatoen på det tidspunkt, som betalingstjenesteudbyderen angiver.
reference value:
Mandate's period of validity, revocation
The mandate is valid until further notice. The payer has the right to revoke the mandate at any time by contacting the payee or his or her payment service provider. In order to stop payments not yet carried out, the notice of the revocation of the mandate must be received by the payee no later than five banking business days before the due date or be received by the payer's payment service provider no later than the banking business day before the due date at the point in time indicated by the payment service provider.
description:
Mandate's period of validity, revocation
The mandate is valid until further notice. The payer has the right to revoke the mandate at any time by contacting the payee or his or her payment service provider. In order to stop payments not yet carried out, the notice of the revocation of the mandate must be received by the payee no later than five banking business days before the due date or be received by the payer's payment service provider no later than the banking business day before the due date at the point in time indicated by the payment service provider.

value:
Generelt
Autogiro er en betalingstjeneste, der betyder, at betalinger udføres fra betalerens konto på betalingsmodtagerens initiativ. For at betaleren skal kunne betale gennem Autogiro, skal betaleren give sit eller hendes samtykke til betalingsmodtageren om, at betalingsmodtageren kan starte betalinger fra betalerens konto. Derudover skal betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyder (f.eks. Bank eller betalingsinstitut) godkende, at kontoen kan bruges til Autogiro, og betalingsmodtager skal godkende betaleren som bruger af Autogiro.
reference value:
General
Autogiro is a payment service that means that payments are carried out from the payer's account on the initiative of the payee. For the payer to be able to pay through Autogiro, the payer must provide his or her consent to the payee that the payee may initiate payments from the payer's account. In addition, the payer's payment service provider (e.g. bank or payment institution) must approve that the account can be used for Autogiro and the payee must approve of the payer as a user of Autogiro.
description:
General
Autogiro is a payment service that means that payments are carried out from the payer's account on the initiative of the payee. For the payer to be able to pay through Autogiro, the payer must provide his or her consent to the payee that the payee may initiate payments from the payer's account. In addition, the payer's payment service provider (e.g. bank or payment institution) must approve that the account can be used for Autogiro and the payee must approve of the payer as a user of Autogiro.

value: Betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyder er ikke forpligtet til på forhånd at kontrollere autorisationen for eller underrette betaleren om anmodede udbetalinger. Udbetalinger opkræves på betalerens konto i overensstemmelse med de regler, der gælder hos betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyder. Betaleren modtager underretning om udbetalinger fra sin betalingstjenesteudbyder. På anmodning fra betaleren kan mandatet overføres til en anden konto hos betalingstjenesteudbyderen eller til en konto hos en anden betalingstjenesteudbyder.
reference value: The payer's payment service provider is not obliged to check the authorisation of or notify the payer of requested withdrawals in advance. Withdrawals are charged to the payer's account in accordance with the rules that apply at the payer's payment service provider. The payer receives notification of withdrawals from his or her payment service provider. On request of the payer, the mandate can be transferred to another account with the payment service provider or to an account with another payment service provider.
description: The payer's payment service provider is not obliged to check the authorisation of or notify the payer of requested withdrawals in advance. Withdrawals are charged to the payer's account in accordance with the rules that apply at the payer's payment service provider. The payer receives notification of withdrawals from his or her payment service provider. On request of the payer, the mandate can be transferred to another account with the payment service provider or to an account with another payment service provider.

value: Undertegnede ("betaleren") giver samtykke til, at betaling foretages ved tilbagetrækning fra den angivne konto eller en konto, som betaleren har angivet på et senere tidspunkt efter anmodning fra den angivne betalingsmodtager om betaling til betalingsmodtageren på en bestemt dato ("forfalden dato ") gennem Autogiro. Betaleren giver samtykke til, at behandling af personoplysninger, der er angivet i dette mandat, håndteres af betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyder, betalingsmodtager, betalingsmodtagerens betalingstjenesteudbyder og Bankgirot AB til administration af tjenesten. Personlige databehandlere til denne behandling af personlige data er betalers betalingstjenesteudbyder, betalingsmodtager og betalingsmodtagerens betalingstjenesteudbyder. Betaleren kan når som helst anmode om at få adgang til eller korrigere de personlige data ved at kontakte betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyder. Yderligere information om behandling af personoplysninger i forbindelse med betalinger findes i vilkårene for kontoen og i aftalen med betalingsmodtageren. Betaleren kan når som helst tilbagekalde sit samtykke, som afslutter tjenesten i sin helhed.
reference value: The undersigned ("the payer"), consents to payment being made by withdrawal from the account indicated or an account indicated by the payer at a later time on request of the indicated payee for payment to the payee on a certain date ("the due date") through Autogiro. The payer consents to processing of personal data provided in this mandate being handled by the payer's payment service provider, the payee, the payee's payment service provider and Bankgirot AB for the administration of the service. Personal data managers for this personal data processing are the payer's payment service provider, the payee and the payee's payment service provider. The payer may at any time request to receive access to or correction of the personal data by contacting the payer's payment service provider. Further information regarding the processing of personal data in connection with payments may be found in the terms and conditions for the account and in the agreement with the payee. The payer can at any time revoke his or her consent, which concludes the service in its entirety.
description: The undersigned ("the payer"), consents to payment being made by withdrawal from the account indicated or an account indicated by the payer at a later time on request of the indicated payee for payment to the payee on a certain date ("the due date") through Autogiro. The payer consents to processing of personal data provided in this mandate being handled by the payer's payment service provider, the payee, the payee's payment service provider and Bankgirot AB for the administration of the service. Personal data managers for this personal data processing are the payer's payment service provider, the payee and the payee's payment service provider. The payer may at any time request to receive access to or correction of the personal data by contacting the payer's payment service provider. Further information regarding the processing of personal data in connection with payments may be found in the terms and conditions for the account and in the agreement with the payee. The payer can at any time revoke his or her consent, which concludes the service in its entirety.

value:
Tilstrækkelige midler skal være tilgængelige på kontoen
Betaler skal sikre, at der er tilstrækkelige midler til rådighed på kontoen senest kl. 12:01 på forfaldsdagen. Hvis betaleren ikke har tilstrækkelige midler på kontoen på forfaldsdatoen, kan det betyde, at betalinger ikke kan gennemføres. Hvis der ikke er tilstrækkelige midler til rådighed til betaling på forfaldsdatoen, kan betalingsmodtageren foretage yderligere udbetalingsforsøg i løbet af de kommende bankdage. Betaleren kan modtage information fra betalingsmodtageren efter anmodning om antallet af tilbagetrækningsforsøg.
reference value:
Sufficient funds must be available in the account
The payer must ensure that sufficient funds are available in the account no later than 12:01 a.m. on the due date. If the payer does not have sufficient funds in the account on the due date, it may mean that payments cannot be carried out. If sufficient funds are unavailable for payment on the due date, the payee may make additional withdrawal attempts during the coming banking business days. The payer can receive information from the payee upon request regarding the number of withdrawal attempts.
description:
Sufficient funds must be available in the account
The payer must ensure that sufficient funds are available in the account no later than 12:01 a.m. on the due date. If the payer does not have sufficient funds in the account on the due date, it may mean that payments cannot be carried out. If sufficient funds are unavailable for payment on the due date, the payee may make additional withdrawal attempts during the coming banking business days. The payer can receive information from the payee upon request regarding the number of withdrawal attempts.

value:
Stop betaling (tilbagekaldelse af betalingsordre)
Betaler kan stoppe en betaling ved at kontakte enten betalingsmodtageren senest to bankdage før forfaldsdatoen eller hans eller hendes betalingstjenesteudbyder senest end bankarbejdsdagen før forfaldsdatoen på det tidspunkt, der er angivet af betalingstjenesteudbyderen. Hvis betaleren stopper en betaling som beskrevet ovenfor, betyder det, at den aktuelle betaling stoppes ved en enkelt lejlighed. Hvis betaleren ønsker, at alle fremtidige betalinger, der er initieret af betalingsmodtageren, skal stoppes, skal betaleren tilbagekalde mandatet.
reference value:
Stop payment (revocation of payment order)
The payer may stop a payment by contacting either the payee no later than two banking business days before the due date or his or her payment service provider no later than the banking business day before the due date at the point in time indicated by the payment service provider. If the payer stops a payment as per the above, it means that the current payment is stopped on a single occasion. If the payer wants all future payments initiated by the payee to be stopped, the payer must revoke the mandate.
description:
Stop payment (revocation of payment order)
The payer may stop a payment by contacting either the payee no later than two banking business days before the due date or his or her payment service provider no later than the banking business day before the due date at the point in time indicated by the payment service provider. If the payer stops a payment as per the above, it means that the current payment is stopped on a single occasion. If the payer wants all future payments initiated by the payee to be stopped, the payer must revoke the mandate.

value:
Definition af bankhverdag
En bankhverdag refererer til alle dage undtagen lørdag, søndag, midsommeraften, juleaften eller nytårsaften eller en anden offentlig helligdag.
reference value:
Definition of banking business day
A banking business day refers to all days except Saturday, Sunday, Midsummer's Eve, Christmas Eve or New Year's Eve or another public holiday.
description:
Definition of banking business day
A banking business day refers to all days except Saturday, Sunday, Midsummer's Eve, Christmas Eve or New Year's Eve or another public holiday.

value:
Oplysninger om betaling
Betaleren vil blive underrettet af betalingsmodtager om beløb, forfaldsdato og betalingsmiddel senest otte bankdage før forfaldsdatoen. Dette kan meddeles inden hver enkelt forfaldsdato eller ved en lejlighed vedrørende flere fremtidige forfaldsdatoer. Hvis meddelelsen henviser til flere fremtidige forfaldsdatoer, skal meddelelsen ske senest otte bankdage før den første forfaldsdato. Dette gælder dog ikke i tilfælde, hvor betaleren har godkendt tilbagetrækningen i forbindelse med et køb eller en ordre af et produkt eller en tjeneste. I et sådant tilfælde modtager betaleren en meddelelse fra betalingsmodtageren om beløb, forfaldsdato og betalingsmiddel i forbindelse med købet og / eller ordren. Ved at underskrive dette mandat giver betaleren sit samtykke til, at betalinger, der er omfattet af betalingsmodtagerens meddelelse i overensstemmelse med dette afsnit, gennemføres.
reference value:
Information on payment
The payer will be notified by the payee of the amount, due date and means of payment no later than eight banking business days before the due date. This can be notified prior to every individual due date or on one occasion concerning several future due dates. If the notification refers to several future due dates, the notification must be made no later than eight banking business days before the first due date. However, this does not apply to cases in which the payer has approved the withdrawal in conjunction with a purchase or order of a product or service. In such a case, the payer receives a notice from the payee regarding the amount, due date and means of payment in conjunction with the purchase and/or the order. By signing this mandate, the payer provides his or her consent to payments covered by the payee's notification in accordance with this section being carried out.
description:
Information on payment
The payer will be notified by the payee of the amount, due date and means of payment no later than eight banking business days before the due date. This can be notified prior to every individual due date or on one occasion concerning several future due dates. If the notification refers to several future due dates, the notification must be made no later than eight banking business days before the first due date. However, this does not apply to cases in which the payer has approved the withdrawal in conjunction with a purchase or order of a product or service. In such a case, the payer receives a notice from the payee regarding the amount, due date and means of payment in conjunction with the purchase and/or the order. By signing this mandate, the payer provides his or her consent to payments covered by the payee's notification in accordance with this section being carried out.

value: I dag, idet jeg er %{date}, ved at indtaste mit routing- og kontonummer ovenfor og klikke på "Autoriser", godkender jeg, at alle mine abonnementer og engangsbetalinger behandles som elektroniske pengeoverførsler (EFT) eller kladder trukket fra min kontrol- eller opsparingskonto som angivet ovenfor og om nødvendigt elektroniske kreditter til min konto for at rette fejlagtige debiteringer. Jeg forstår, at min betaling behandles inden for 1-2 bankdage. Hvis nogen af ​​mine betalinger returneres ubetalt, giver jeg dig eller din tjenesteudbyder tilladelse til at opkræve den returnerede betaling og min stats returgebyr for hver sådan betaling via EFT (er) eller kladde (r) trukket fra min konto. Hvis du bruger Telecheck, skal du klikke her for at se statens returnerede varegebyr og, hvis relevant, omkostninger. Jeg forstår, at denne tilladelse forbliver i fuld kraft, indtil jeg giver dig besked om, at jeg ønsker at tilbagekalde den ved at ringe til %{merchant_phone} og tillod dig rimelig mulighed for at reagere på min meddelelse.
reference value: Today, being %{date}, by entering my routing and account number above and clicking “Authorize,” I authorize all my subscription and one time payments to be processed as electronic funds transfers (EFT) or drafts drawn from my checking or savings account as indicated above and, if necessary, electronic credits to my account to correct erroneous debits. I understand that my payment will process within 1-2 banking days. If any of my payments return unpaid, I authorize you or your service provider to collect the returned payment and my state’s return item fee for each such payment by EFT(s) or draft(s) drawn from my account. I understand that this authorization will remain in full force and effect until I notify you that I wish to revoke it by calling %{merchant_phone} and allowed you reasonable opportunity to act on my notice.

value:
Specifikke betingelser for meddelelser og tvister
Jeg kan bede min bank om at tilbageføre en direkte debitering op til 120 kalenderdage efter debitering, hvis:
  • Jeg modtager ikke en skriftlig meddelelse om beløbet og datoen for hver direkte debitering fra initiativtager, eller jeg modtager en skriftlig meddelelse, men beløbet eller datoen for debitering er forskellig fra det beløb eller den dato, der er angivet i meddelelsen.
  • Jeg må bede min bank om at tilbageføre en direkte debitering op til 9 måneder efter den dato, hvor initiativtageren sendte den første direkte debitering under autoriteten, hvis jeg ikke med rimelighed er tilfreds med, at autoriteten autoriserede min bank til at debitere min konto med beløbet for direkte debitering.
  • - Initiativtageren skal give en skriftlig meddelelse om beløb og dato for hver direkte debitering, inklusive den første direkte debitering i en serie, på ikke mindre end 2 hverdage. Meddelelsen skal omfatte: datoerne for debiteringer og størrelsen af ​​hver direkte debitering.
  • Hvis initiativtager foreslår at ændre et beløb eller en dato for en direkte debitering, der er specificeret i meddelelsen, er initiativtageren forpligtet til at give dig besked mindst ti dage før ændringen.
  • Hvis banken vanærer en direkte debitering, men initiativtager sender direkte debitering en anden gang inden for 5 hverdage efter den oprindelige direkte debitering, er initiator ikke påkrævet for at give dig anden gang besked om beløbet og datoen for direkte debitering
reference value:
Specific conditions relating to notices and disputes
I may ask my bank to reverse a direct debit upto 120 calendar days after the debit if:
  • I don’t receive a written notice of the amount and date of each direct debit from the initiator, or I receivea written notice but the amount or the date of debiting is different from the amount or the date specified onthe notice.
  • I may ask my bank to reverse a direct debit up to 9 months after the date the initiator sent the first directdebit under the authority if I am not reasonably satisfied that the authority authorised my bank to debit my account with the amount of the direct debit.- The initiator is required to give a written notice of theamount and date of each direct debit, including the first direct debit in a series, of no less than 2 workingdays. The notice is to include: the dates of the debits, and the amount of each direct debit.
  • If the initiator proposes to change an amount or date of a direct debit specified in the notice, the initiatoris required to give you notice no less than 10 days before the change.
  • If the bank dishonours a direct debit but the initiator sends the direct debit a second time within 5 businessdays of the original direct debit, the initiator is not required to notify you a second time of the amount anddate of the direct debit
description:
Specific conditions relating to notices and disputes

  • I don’t receive a written notice of the amount and date of each direct debit from the initiator, or I receivea written notice but the amount or the date of debiting is different from the amount or the date specified onthe notice.
  • I may ask my bank to reverse a direct debit up to 9 months after the date the initiator sent the first directdebit under the authority if I am not reasonably satisfied that the authority authorised my bank to debit my account with the amount of the direct debit.- The initiator is required to give a written notice of theamount and date of each direct debit, including the first direct debit in a series, of no less than 2 workingdays. The notice is to include: the dates of the debits, and the amount of each direct debit.
  • If the initiator proposes to change an amount or date of a direct debit specified in the notice, the initiatoris required to give you notice no less than 10 days before the change.
  • If the bank dishonours a direct debit but the initiator sends the direct debit a second time within 5 businessdays of the original direct debit, the initiator is not required to notify you a second time of the amount anddate of the direct debit

value:
Serviceaftale med direkte debitering

Følgende er din Serviceaftale med direkte debitering med %{merchant_name}. Aftalen er designet til at forklare, hvad dine forpligtelser er, når du indgår en ordning med direkte debitering med købmanden. Den beskriver også, hvad sælgerens forpligtelser er over for dig som initiativtager til direkte debitering.
Vi anbefaler, at du holder denne aftale et sikkert sted til fremtidig reference. Det er en del af vilkårene og betingelserne i din direkte debiteringsanmodning (DDR) og skal læses sammen med din DDR-formular.

Definitioner

Konto betyder den konto, der opbevares i din finansielle institution, hvorfra vi har tilladelse til at sørge for, at midler debiteres
Aftale betyder denne serviceaftale om anmodning om direkte debitering mellem dig og forhandleren
Bank dag betyder en anden dag end en lørdag eller en søndag eller en offentlig helligdag, der er opført i hele Australien
Debet dag betyder den dag, som din betaling til forhandleren forfalder
Debetbetaling betyder en bestemt transaktion, hvor der debiteres
anmodning om direkte debitering betyder anmodning om direkte debitering mellem sælgeren og dig
forhandler betyder organisation, du har godkendt ved at underskrive en anmodning om direkte debitering og som defineret ovenfor
Du betyder den kunde, der underskrev anmodningen om direkte debitering
Din finansielle institution betyder den finansielle institution, der er udpeget af dig på DDR, hvor kontoen opretholdes ained.
1. Debitering af din konto
Ved at underskrive en anmodning om direkte debitering har du godkendt forhandleren til at sørge for, at der debiteres penge fra din konto. Du skal henvise til anmodningen om direkte debitering og denne aftale for vilkårene for arrangementet mellem sælgeren og dig. Forhandleren vil kun sørge for, at der debiteres penge fra din konto som godkendt i anmodningen om direkte debitering.
Hvis debiteringsdagen falder på en dag, der ikke er en bankdag, kan Forhandleren pålægge din finansielle institution at debitere din konto den følgende bankdag.
Hvis du er usikker på, hvilken dag din konto har eller vil blive debiteret, skal du spørge din finansielle institution.
2. Ændringer foretaget af forhandleren
Forhandleren kan til enhver tid variere detaljer i denne aftale eller en direkte debiteringsanmodning ved at give dig mindst fjorten (14) dages skriftlig varsel.
3. Ændringer foretaget af dig
Du kan ændre, stoppe eller udsætte en debetbetaling eller opsige denne aftale ved at give Merchant mindst 14 (14) dages varsel ved at kontakte Merchant i arbejdstiden eller arrangere det gennem din egen finansielle institution.
4. Dine forpligtelser
Det er dit ansvar at sikre, at der er tilstrækkelige klare midler til rådighed på din konto til at tillade, at der foretages en debetbetaling i overensstemmelse med anmodningen om direkte debitering. Hvis der ikke er tilstrækkelige klare midler på din konto til at imødekomme en debetbetaling:
a) Du kan blive opkrævet et gebyr og / eller renter af din finansielle institution; og
b) Du skal sørge for, at debetbetalingen foretages efter en anden metode eller sørge for, at der er tilstrækkelige klare midler til at være på din konto inden for et aftalt tidspunkt, så Forhandleren kan behandle debetbetalingen.
Du skal kontrollere dit kontoudtog for at kontrollere, at beløbene debiteret fra din konto er korrekte.
5. Tvist
Hvis du mener, at der har været en fejl i debitering af din konto, skal du underrette sælgeren direkte. Alternativt kan du tage det direkte op med din finansielle institution.
Hvis Forhandleren konkluderer som et resultat af undersøgelser, at din konto er blevet debiteret forkert, svarer Forhandleren på din forespørgsel ved at sørge for, at din finansielle institution justerer din konto (inklusive renter og gebyrer) i overensstemmelse hermed. Forhandleren underretter dig også skriftligt om det beløb, hvormed din konto er blevet justeret.
Hvis Forhandleren har konkluderet, at som følge af undersøgelser, at din konto ikke er blevet fejlagtigt debiteret, vil Forhandleren svare på din forespørgsel ved at give dig grunde og ethvert bevis for dette fund skriftligt.
6. Konti
Du bør kontrollere:
a) Med din finansielle institution, om direkte debitering er tilgængelig fra din konto, da direkte debitering ikke er tilgængelig på alle konti, der tilbydes af finansielle institutioner .
b) Dine kontooplysninger, som du har givet os, er korrekte ved at kontrollere dem mod en nylig kontoudskrift; og
c) Med din finansielle institution inden du udfylder anmodningen om direkte debitering, hvis du har spørgsmål om, hvordan du gennemfører direkte debiteringsanmodningen.
7. Fortrolighed
Forhandleren vil opbevare alle oplysninger (inklusive dine kontooplysninger) i din anmodning om direkte debitering fortroligt. Forhandleren vil gøre en rimelig indsats for at holde sådanne oplysninger beskyttet og for at sikre, at nogen af ​​Merchants medarbejdere eller agenter, der har adgang til oplysninger om dig, ikke foretager uautoriseret brug, ændring, reproduktion eller videregivelse af disse oplysninger.
Forhandleren vil kun videregive oplysninger om dig:
a) I det omfang det specifikt kræves af loven; eller.
b) I forbindelse med denne aftale (inkluderet afsløring af oplysninger i forbindelse med enhver forespørgsel eller krav til din finansielle institution).
8. Bemærk
Forhandleren giver dig besked ved at sende en meddelelse til den e-mail-adresse, der er angivet i anmodningen om direkte debitering. Hvis du har brug for at kontakte Merchant, bedes du ringe eller e-maile Merchant direkte. Meddelelse anses for at være modtaget på tidspunktet for transmission af meddelelses-e-mailen.
reference value:
Direct Debit Service Agreement

The following is your Direct Debit Service Agreement with %{merchant_name}. The agreement is designed to explain what your obligations are when undertaking a Direct Debit arrangement with the Merchant. It also details what the Merchant’s obligations are to you as the Direct Debit Initiator.
We recommend you keep this agreement in a safe place for future reference. It forms part of the terms and conditions of your Direct Debit Request (DDR) and should be read in conjunction with your DDR form.

Definitions

Account means the account held at your financial institution from which we are authorised to arrange for funds to be debited
Agreement means this Direct Debit Request Service Agreement between you and the Merchant
Banking day means a day other than a Saturday or a Sunday or a public holiday listed throughout Australia
Debit day means the day that payment by you to the Merchant is due
Debit payment means a particular transaction where a debit is made
Direct debit request means the Direct Debit Request between the Merchant and you
Merchant means the organisation you have authorised by signing a direct debit request and as defined above
You means the customer who signed the Direct Debit Request
Your financial institution means the financial institution nominated by you on the DDR at which the account is maintained.
1. Debiting your account
By signing a Direct Debit Request, you have authorised the Merchant to arrange for funds to be debited from your account. You should refer to the Direct Debit Request and this agreement for the terms of the arrangement between the Merchant and you.The Merchant will only arrange for funds to be debited from your account as authorised in the Direct Debit Request.
If the debit day falls on a day that is not a banking day, the Merchant may direct your financial institution to debit your account on the following banking day.
If you are unsure about which day your account has or will be debited you should ask your financial institution.
2. Amendments by the merchant
The merchant may vary any details of this agreement or a Direct Debit Request at any time by giving you at least fourteen (14) days’ written notice.
3. Amendments by you
You may change, stop or defer a debit payment, or terminate this agreement by providing the Merchant with at least fourteen (14) days’ notification by contacting the Merchant during business hours or arranging it through your own financial institution.
4. Your obligations
It is your responsibility to ensure that there are sufficient clear funds available in your account to allow a debit payment to be made in accordance with the Direct Debit Request. If there are insufficient clear funds in your account to meet a debit payment:
a) You may be charged a fee and/or interest by your financial institution; and
b) You must arrange for the debit payment to be made by another method or arrange for sufficient clear funds to be in your account by an agreed time so that the Merchant can process the debit payment.
You should check your account statement to verify that the amounts debited from your account are correct.
5. Dispute
If you believe that there has been an error in debiting your account, you should notify the Merchant directly. Alternatively, you can take it up with your financial institution directly.
If the Merchant concludes as a result of investigations that your account has been incorrectly debited the Merchant will respond to your query by arranging for your financial institution to adjust your account (including interest and charges) accordingly. The Merchant will also notify you in writing of the amount by which your account has been adjusted.
If the Merchant has concluded that as a result of investigations that your account has not been incorrectly debited, the Merchant will respond to your query by providing you with reasons and any evidence for this finding in writing.
6. Accounts
You should check:
a) With your financial institution whether direct debiting is available from your account as direct debiting is not available on all accounts offered by financial institutions.
b) Your account details which you have provided to us are correct by checking them against a recent account statement; and
c) With your financial institution before completing the Direct Debit Request if you have any queries about how to complete the Direct Debit Request.
7. Confidentiality
The Merchant will keep any information (including your account details) in your Direct Debit Request confidential. The Merchant will make reasonable efforts to keep any such information held secure and to ensure that any of the Merchants employees or agents who have access to information about you do not make any unauthorised use, modification, reproduction or disclosure of that information.
The Merchant will only disclose information held about you:
a) To the extent specifically required by law; or.
b) For the purposes of this agreement (including disclosing information in connection with any query or claim to your Financial Institution).
8. Notice
The Merchant will notify you by sending a notice to the email address given in the Direct Debit Request. Should you need to contact the Merchant, please call or email the Merchant directly. Notice will be deemed to have been received at the time of transmission of the notification email.

value:
Modtagerens og betalerens betalingstjenesteudbyders ret til at afslutte forbindelsen til Autogiro
Modtager har ret til at afslutte betalerforbindelsen til Autogiro 30 dage efter, at betalingsmodtageren har underrettet betaleren herom . Modtager har dog ret til straks at afslutte betalers forbindelse til Autogiro, hvis betaleren ved gentagne lejligheder ikke har en tilstrækkelig kontosaldo på forfaldsdatoen, hvis den konto, som mandatet vedrører, er lukket, eller hvis betalingsmodtageren finder, at betaleren bør ikke deltage i Autogiro af en anden grund.
reference value:
The right for the payee and the payer's payment service provider to end the connection to Autogiro
The payee has the right to end the payer's connection to Autogiro 30 days after the payee has notified the payer thereof. However, the payee has the right to immediately end the payer's connection to Autogiro if the payer on repeated occasions does not have a sufficient account balance on the due date, if the account to which the mandate pertains is closed or if the payee deems that the payer should not participate in Autogiro for another reason.
description:
The right for the payee and the payer's payment service provider to end the connection to Autogiro
